comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Looks like Bo Sweeney. I started a Wikipedia entry for him: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bo_Sweeney

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Yup, Bo Sweeney was assistant Secretary of the Interior from 1914, native of Missouri, resident of Seattle.  He died 1917, from heart problems.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: It sure does appear to be Bo Sweeney.  Thanks to both of you.

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Bo Sweeney married the former Lillian E. Reeves (1880-1929) on February 2, 1898. She was the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. W. L. Reeves of Trinidad, Colorado.[1] Bo Sweeney (1862-1917) was a lawyer, and a state representative (D) in Colorado, before moving to Seattle. [2] A photo of Mrs. Sweeney is in the Bain / LOC Collection on Flickr:   Information cited in this comment does not comport with the Wikipedia reference given in the comments.
